Astarion: So, 'the Blade of Frontiers'? You didn't want to trade it for a flashier name?
Wyll: An old name, for certain. But a new man to bear it.
Wyll: The four pillars finally rise within me. Courage, Insight, strategy, justice.
Wyll: I'm not to abide them, but to become them.
Wyll: A hero is not just - he is justice. He is not courageous - he is courage.
Wyll: Ah, but enough reflection for today. I'm of a mind to celebrate.
Player: Better make room for Mizora in that little party of yours.
Wyll: You hunt the meat, I'll scrounge up the ale. Prepare your belly for roast a la Blade!
Player: What are your plans as the Blade, once the brain is defeated?
Wyll: I do what I do best. Answering the calls of the needful, killing the monsters that haunt them -
Wyll: - and showing them they won't be abandoned.
Player: There's more to your plans than you're letting on, isn't there?
Wyll: *Sigh* Yes. There is.
Wyll: I will be hunting Mizora.
Wyll: I won't let her claim one more soul, slay one more victim. I'm going to make my way to the Hells and tear the horns right off her damned head.
Player: Let it go, Wyll. There are better ways to help the people of the Sword Coast.
Wyll: Part of me wants to argue. To insist that I'd be killing Mizora for the good of the Coast.
Wyll: But I can't. Not when I know I'm killing her out of revenge.
Wyll: You're right - I need to forget Mizora. The people of the Coast call to the Blade. I can't let myself stray from them.
Player: What are your plans as the Blade, once the brain is defeated?

Wyll: I love the Coast, I love its people. The Blade of Avernus will toil for them...
Wyll: ... but he'd rather not toil alone.
Wyll: Faerûn doesn't need just one hero. It needs two. Say you'll fight with me.
Player: Nothing would make me happier.

Barcus Wroot: I know someone of your background would fit right in in that heart of horrors, but for others of us it's quite a frightening prospect.
Barcus Wroot: And so... to Moonrise Towers I go.

Wyll: Gods. You've made me the happiest soul in all the Realms.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: The player takes the acorn from Wyll's hands. He smiles, but remains kneeling.
Narrator: *Your skin flushes and your soul sings as you palm the acorn. Wishing magic, affection, love - whatever the cause, it's as real as the ground beneath you.*
Wyll: Get down here, already. It's time we started our happily-ever-after!
Player: It's about time. Let's see what the Blade can do with his weapon.
Player: Join Wyll in the grass. Give yourself to him completely.

Narrator: *Wyll's tadpole resonates with Ravengard's. The exhausted Grand Duke is a flurry of emotion - gratitude and relief, anger and deep pain.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My own son, still the she-devil's toy. Is this my fate - to be freed from Gortash's hell only to be trapped in yours?
Wyll: It isn't what you think. It never was.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You turned your back on me, on your city, to chase the she-devil and her power. She stinks up this place even now.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: It is exactly what I think.
Player: Call on the parasite, connect with father and son. Ravengard should know the truth.
Narrator: *Ravengard's tadpole clenches as your memories - and Wyll's - flow into him.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: By Tyr's wounds - I'm in your mind...
Narrator: *The Grand Duke sees Mizora and her infernal sisters. He sees the agony in Wyll's face as an impossible choice is set before him.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: No. My son -
Narrator: *The past becomes present, and Wyll's thoughts are laid bare. Ravengard sees Wyll partnering with Mizora to defeat Tiamat's cultists before they could lay siege to Baldur's Gate.*
Narrator: *And he sees everything beyond. The nautiloid journey, the perilous path to Moonrise, the Astral Prism, and the Emperor within.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Wyll.
Wyll: Everything I did, I did for Baldur's Gate. I did for you.
Player: Heh. I bet you feel like a real bastard right about now.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I do. And I should.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My son, you sold your soul to save Baldur's Gate - and I cast you out for it.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You gave yourself to the Hells' eternal fires so I might walk free.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: By the gods, can you ever forgive me?
Wyll: There's nothing to forgive. You wanted to protect the city. I only ever wanted the same.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You are a better man than most, and a better son than I deserve. I'll yet make amends, but -
Duke Ulder Ravengard: - my duty is first and foremost to the city and its people. There's something I must ask of you.
Player: Go on.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Before I was captured, I was on a mission.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Returning from Elturel, I discovered the plans of the Absolutists. I immediately realised the city couldn't defend itself against such an army.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I didn't despair because the city has a secret guardian, a wyrm that sleeps beneath. He can be called upon in times of great need.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: This is such a time. You've been trained in the ways of the great champions and proven to be one of them. The wyrm will answer your call. You must seek him out.
Player: Waking a dragon doesn't sound like a good idea.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: This is no ordinary dragon.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Since then, the city has faced countless threats, but we always overcame. There was never a need to call on the wyrm - until now.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: The Absolute is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. The wyrm must be awakened - and the task falls to you.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I once held a copy, but it was stolen. Find it, let it set the path before you.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Let it set the path before you.
Player: Wyll? What do you make of this?

Player: Go on.
Player: The wyrm is dead, but his spirit lives within me. I've pledged to follow in your footsteps!
Duke Ulder Ravengard: A terrible fate for Ansur, my son. Yet my hopes for the city's future have never been higher.
Wyll: I don't understand.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You and your allies slayed the undead terror that was once the great Ansur. You are stronger than even the great wyrm.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You will be the one to part the storms and lead the people through. You, not Ansur, are the saviour we need.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: First, you will fell the Absolute. Then, we will rebuild Baldur's Gate, we will take back our city - together.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I will name you Baldur's Gate's newest Grand Duke of the Council. You will be hailed Heart of the Gate.
Wyll: Grand Duke? My soul lies with the city. But...
Duke Ulder Ravengard: But what, Wyll?
Wyll: I have slain monsters, faced illithids, guarded the helpless. To be a duke - is this the destiny I've awaited? Is the nobility my calling?
Player: Wyll, Mizora could be a dangerous influence. You can't accept your father's offer.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: There will be no Grand Duke Wyll Ravengard.
Wyll: I am the defender of the weak, I am the stalker of devils -
Wyll: I am the Blade of Frontiers!
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My boy, my blood. Let it be known: the Blade is on the hunt. Feel his sting!
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Hail the Blade of Frontiers!
Gale: The Blade of Frontiers!
Narrator: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but with the Blade of Frontiers at your side, you know you can triumph.*

Wyll: 'The Blade of Avernus.' A new name for a changed man.
Wyll: Ah, but enough reflection for today. I'm of a mind to celebrate.
Player: Eh, I'll leave you to it.
Player: There's more to your plans than you're letting on, isn't there?
Wyll: *Sigh* Yes. There is.
Wyll: I will be hunting Mizora.
Wyll: I won't let her claim one more soul, slay one more victim. I'm going to make my way to the Hells and tear the horns right off her damned head.
Player: Let it go, Wyll. There are better ways to help the people of the Sword Coast.
Wyll: Part of me wants to argue. To insist that I'd be killing Mizora for the good of the Coast.
Wyll: But I can't. Not when I know I'm killing her out of revenge.
Wyll: You're right - I need to forget Mizora. The people of the Coast call to the Blade. I can't let myself stray from them.
Player: What are your plans as the Blade, once the brain is defeated?
Wyll: I scout both the Hells and the Coast's havens. And I destroy every fiend that dares put its eye on Faerûn.
Player: There's more to your plans than you're letting on, isn't there?
Wyll: *Sigh* Yes. There is.
Wyll: I will be hunting Mizora.
Wyll: I won't let her claim one more soul, slay one more victim. I'm going to make my way to the Hells and tear the horns right off her damned head.
Player: You need to destroy her. She doesn't deserve any better.
Wyll: Damn right. I'll cut her to ribbons before she can so much as groan Zariel's name.
Player: What are your plans as the Blade, once the brain is defeated? What about us?
Wyll: I love the Coast, I love its people. The Blade of Frontiers belongs to them...
Wyll: ... but Wyll Ravengard belongs to you.
Wyll: Faerûn doesn't need just one hero. It needs two. Say you'll fight with me.
Player: Nothing would make me happier.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: Wyll enters camp. A diabolical circle draws itself onto the ground in front of Wyll, and Mizora in devil form rises from it.
Mizora: Sorores surge. Testis esto pacti mei.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Two more diabolical circles form, and a female devil rises from each.
Narrator: *You've heard of such devils - Sisters of Justice, adjudicators of diabolical contracts and bargains.*
Karlach: Holy fucking hells.
Wyll: What are you up to, Mizora?
Mizora: I come to bargain. The Hells demand witness.
Mizora: Your father is dead, Wyll. The Dead Three have claimed their prize.
Wyll: Shit. What did you do, Mizora?
Mizora: I had no hand in your father's death, Wyll. But that doesn't mean he might not still live.
Arbiter Cirrus: Infernus contractus te vocamus. Infernus contractus te vocamus. Infernus contractus te vocamus.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: A contract appears in the air, glowing. It is Wyll's contract.
Wyll: Then break it now, Mizora. I don't need to wait six months.
Mizora: No contract is ended without sacrifice. A cost must be paid.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Flames ignite Mizora and her two companions. Mizora's voice echos outward as if amplified by the Hells themselves.
Mizora: Wyll Ravengard. A choice is before you.
Mizora: Option one. I show you the way to your father. I guarantee him no harm except that from you and your allies. And you pledge your soul to me and the archdevil Zariel in a pact eternal.
Mizora: Option two. I break your pact, and you are freed from your duty. Your father dies by his enemy's hand, and Baldur's Gate loses its greatest champion.
Mizora: Name your sacrifice.
Karlach: Bloody Zariel. I won't let her take Wyll!
Wyll: Mizora, you arsehole.
Mizora: Choose.
Player: Save your father, Wyll. The city will need him to help rebuild.

Zevlor: Aradin didn't make it? Pity - but he might've got more of my people killed, if not for you.
Zevlor: Forgive that display. Aradin's a blowhard, but that's no cause for me to join him.
Zevlor: Thank you for your help out there. I'm Zevlor.
Zevlor: And if I'm not mistaken, you're the Blade of Frontiers.
Player: Please - it's just Wyll.
Zevlor: Well met, by whatever name. Though I'm afraid that's all the welcome we can give you.
Zevlor: Whatever your business, I'd see to it quickly - the druids are forcing everyone out.
Zevlor: This attack will only strengthen their resolve.
Player: I won't be staying long - I just need to find a healer.
Zevlor: They've started a ritual to cut the grove off from the world outside.
Zevlor: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
Player: What brought you here?
Zevlor: We're refugees from Elturel - we took shelter here after gnolls attacked us on the road.
Zevlor: We were bound for Baldur's Gate, and it was too late to turn back. Elturel had no place for tieflings after the Descent.
Narrator: *You remember it. Elturel and all its citizens were dragged into Avernus - then back out again.*
Player: Let me guess: Your old neighbours called you 'devilkin' and acted like they never knew you.
Zevlor: How easily such a nasty word slips through the mouth of someone you thought you knew.
Zevlor: We thought we'd found sanctuary here, but the druids have determined to turn us out.
Zevlor: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
Player: What brought you here?
Zevlor: We're refugees from Elturel - we took shelter here after gnolls attacked us on the road.
Zevlor: We were bound for Baldur's Gate, and it was too late to turn back. Elturel had no place for tieflings after the Descent.
Player: Should've stayed in the Hells - our kind might be treated better there.
Zevlor: Hah - a fair point. We can only hope the citizens of Baldur's Gate are more open-minded.
Zevlor: But we can't get there with those beasts blocking our path.
Zevlor: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
Player: This ritual - is there no way to convince the druids to stop it?
Zevlor: I've tried. Kagha - their new First Druid - won't even see me.
Zevlor: You, though... I know it's not your business, but she owes you for saving this place.
Zevlor: Perhaps you could persuade her. For more time to prepare, if nothing else.
Player: I'll see what I can do.
Player: I'll find her. And I'll speak to Kagha while I'm there.

Barcus Wroot: Well. You... did it!
Barcus Wroot: I shouldn't be surprised, considering our history. And yet...
Player: I did. But not out of the kindness of my heart.
Barcus Wroot: Right. Ever the pragmatist, hm?
Barcus Wroot: Nothing good happens in the Underdark.
Barcus Wroot: They're not even going after him. I wish I were surprised.
Barcus Wroot: And so... to Moonrise Towers I go.
Gale: Moonrise. We're getting close to the lion's den - and plenty of questions I have for the lion, too.
Player: Do you know what Wulbren and the others were doing down here?
Barcus Wroot: No.
Player: Do you know what the Ironhand Gnomes were doing down here?
Barcus Wroot: No.
Player: Do you know what Wulbren and the others were doing down here?
Barcus Wroot: No.
Player: Farewell, Barcus - I wish you luck with your search.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: [opening, face-to-face]

Wyll and Karlach stand facing one another, fists clenched.

Wyll and Karlach stand facing one another, fists clenched.
Wyll: One horn. The stink of Avernus. Advocatus diaboli.
Karlach: Well I'll be godsdamned - the Blade of Frontiers. Thought I'd shaken you for good. That'll teach me to underestimate you.
Wyll: Karlach. The archdevil Zariel's gladiator, come to burn the Sword Coast to ash.
Player: The two of you have met before, I see.
Karlach: If by 'met' you mean hoofing it through the Hells with this fucker on my tail.
Wyll: Shut it, devil - I know your kind. A heart darker than a shadow's nightmares. You'd cut a child's throat just to taste the blood.
Karlach: A devil? I didn't take the Blade for a fool. I'm - ngh!
Narrator: *A great fire roars through you - the fire of the First Hell.*
Narrator: *You are Karlach, tearing through demons across a blood-red landscape of fire and volcanic cinder.*
Narrator: *The front lines of the Blood War. With every swing of her axe, Karlach fulfils mistress Zariel's purpose.*
Wyll: Proof, clear as summer sky. It's over, Karlach. It's time you feel the sting of the Blade.
Karlach: I've tried to tell you - I'm not what you think I am.
Narrator: *Another vision. Karlach's blade raised, slicing through devils - Zariel's servants - as her eyes dart around, seeking escape.*
Narrator: *Wyll shudders with Karlach's desperation. She is a victim of the Blood War, not an agent of it.*
Wyll: By Balduran's helm, I - no. I will not be tricked!
Karlach: You saw the truth. I may be an effective soldier, but I never wanted to serve Zariel. Legged it away from her the first chance I got.
Wyll: And yet you served.
Player: Be practical. She's infected, same as us. We need allies, not enemies.
Narrator: *Wyll catches his breath, and his lips straighten. Sheer dread twists his face.*
Wyll: No. Devils can not be trusted!
Player: It's you I don't trust, Wyll. You wanted a fight? You've got it.
Karlach: How about we all take a nice deep breath and calm the fuck down. Just cause I want to live doesn't mean I want him dead.
Player: Fine, but he needs to stand down. We saw the truth for ourselves.
Karlach: Would you listen to sense? This doesn't have to end badly - for either of us.
Karlach: You know monsters better than anyone. Can't you look in my eyes and see I'm not a devil?
Wyll: You don't know what this means. You don't know what you're asking me to do.
Karlach: I'm asking you to live, Wyll. I don't want to hurt you. And, to be frank, I'd rather not find out how the Blade got his name.
Karlach: I swear to you, on all I am, I'm not what you think.
Wyll: Shit. Shit.
Wyll: You really are no devil, are you? I've... I've been deceived.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The player approaches Wyll. Wyll is practing his dance moves, oblivious to the player's presence, lost in his reverie.
Player: Stay quiet, and watch Wyll dance.
Wyll: Oh! Sorry. I didn't see you standing there. Lost in the steps, truth be told.
Wyll: I need them to be just right. I wouldn't want to fail my new partner.
Player: Trust me. I don't think you could fail anyone if you tried.
Wyll: I know a few people who might beg to differ. But the only one that matters is here with me now.
Wyll: May I have this dance?
Player: Wyll, I'd love nothing more than to dance with you. But I fear I'd burn you to a crisp.
Wyll: About that. You only burn hottest when your emotions are aflare, right? Anger, excitement, fear... but a dance can be meditative. Calming.
Wyll: If you think you can put your hand in mine without singeing it off, I'm willing to try.
Player: I could try. If you're up for it.
Wyll: It would be an honour.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Player smiles and bows, taking Wyll's hand. Wyll turns guiding the player into the the center of the imaginary dance floor he was using to practice at the start of the scene.

Wyll releases the player's hand, and the two assume courtly posture oppsite eachother.

Wyll releases the player's hand, and the two assume courtly posture oppsite eachother.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Wyll stomps, assuming a paso doble stance. Perfect lines. Intense. He takes a few rhythmic steps foward, playfully invading the player's space while maintaining eye contact.
Player: Gather your strength and leap into the air.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Player leaps into the air, but then stumbles, rights themselves, and smiles at Wyll.
Wyll: Ha ha - ahem. Don't you worry. It takes years to master the Vollante.
Player: You're a beautiful dancer. I'm sure you'll teach me in no time.
Wyll: I'll show you everything I know, and then some - I promise.
Wyll: But perhaps we might try a more intimate style.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Wyll begins a slower dance and the player follows suit.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: The players come closer together until their lips are a hair away of touching.
Player: Press your lips against Wyll's.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: The player kisses Wyll, then pulls away.
Wyll: So much shadow around us. To think I almost missed the light.
Wyll: Well - it's getting late. We can't face the morrow if we don't bid farewell to the now.
Player: I was hoping we might spend the night... together.
Wyll: I'm tempted, trust me. I thought my heart might burst with every step.
Wyll: But I still keep faith in the old tales of love, the once-upon-a-times and the happily-ever-afters.
Wyll: I'd like to do this the proper way. The way of the old romances sung by the bards.
Wyll: Till next time, good night - and dream sweetly.

Novice Grumm: Shit - True Soul Nere's nothing but grub-chow now.

NodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

Wyll: Speak up. You can't just let the clan keep them.

Narrator: *Your tadpole resonates with Ravengard's. The exhausted Grand Duke is a flurry of emotion - gratitude and relief, anger and deep pain.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: W-Wyll? It - it can't be. By Balduran's graces, have you fallen so far that Avernus has taken you?
Duke Ulder Ravengard: First you cleave my heart in twain. Now you shatter it into pieces.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My own son, still the she-devil's toy. Is this my fate - to rise from death into a hell of my own boy's making?
Wyll: It isn't what you think. It never was.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You turned your back on me, on your city, to chase the she-devil and her power. She stinks up this place even now.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: It is exactly what I think.
Player: Your son sacrificed his soul to save yours. He had no choice.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: There is always a choice.
Wyll: Father, please - there's something I must show you.
Narrator: *Ravengard's tadpole clenches as your memories - and Wyll's - flow into him.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: By Tyr's wounds - I'm in your mind...
Narrator: *The Grand Duke sees Mizora and her infernal sisters. He sees the agony in Wyll's face as an impossible choice is set before him.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: No. My son -
Narrator: *The past becomes present, and Wyll's thoughts are laid bare. Ravengard sees Wyll partnering with Mizora to defeat Tiamat's cultists before they could lay siege to Baldur's Gate.*
Narrator: *And he sees everything beyond. The nautiloid journey, the perilous path to Moonrise, the Astral Prism, and the Emperor within.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Wyll.
Wyll: Everything I did, I did for Baldur's Gate. I did for you.
Player: Heh. I bet you feel like a real bastard right about now.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I do. And I should.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My son, you sold your soul to save Baldur's Gate - and I cast you out for it.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You gave yourself to the Hells' eternal fires so I might walk free.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: By the gods, can you ever forgive me?
Wyll: There's nothing to forgive. You wanted to protect the city. I only ever wanted the same.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You are a better man than most, and a better son than I deserve. I'll yet make amends, but -
Duke Ulder Ravengard: - my duty is first and foremost to the city and its people. There's something I must ask of you.
Player: Go on.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Before I was captured, I was on a mission.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Returning from Elturel, I discovered the plans of the Absolutists. I immediately realised the city couldn't defend itself against such an army.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I didn't despair because the city has a secret guardian, a wyrm that sleeps beneath. He can be called upon in times of great need.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: This is such a time. You've been trained in the ways of the great champions and proven to be one of them. The wyrm will answer your call. You must seek him out.
Player: A wyrm? Are you saying there's a dragon living under the city?
Duke Ulder Ravengard: A bronze dragon, yes. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Since then, the city has faced countless threats, but we always overcame. There was never a need to call on the wyrm - until now.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: The Absolute is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. The wyrm must be awakened - and the task falls to you.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I once held a copy, but it was stolen. Find it, let it set the path before you.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Let it set the path before you.
Player: Wyll? What do you make of this?

Wyll: Counsellor Florrick - are you all right?
Player: A story best left for calmer days. Now breathe deeply - are you in pain?
Counsellor Florrick: A scorched throat, a few hairs singed off. Nothing a bit of time and fresh air can't cure.
Counsellor Florrick: Fist Ito, a new duty calls. Drow have taken Grand Duke Ulder Ravengard - westward, if my eyes and ears can be believed.
Counsellor Florrick: Report to the manip and send for reinforcements. We must find the Duke.
Fist Recruit Ito: On your command, Counsellor.
Counsellor Florrick: The rest of you - count the dead. Take word of their sacrifice to the city.
Counsellor Florrick: And you - I must ask again for your aid.
Counsellor Florrick: Please - rescue Ravengard from his drow captors. The Council will reward you for your effort.
Counsellor Florrick: May I trust you'll see it through?
Player: The Absolute's cult is based at Moonrise Towers. That's where they'll have taken the duke.
Counsellor Florrick: Moonrise Towers? Along the old road? That place is cursed. Few could survive there...
Counsellor Florrick: ... unless darker forces are at work.
Counsellor Florrick: This was no random attack. The Grand Duke was their target.
Player: On my oath: I will see Duke Ravengard rescued, and his captors vanquished.
Player: I'll search for Duke Ravengard.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The player approaches Wyll. Wyll is practing his dance moves, oblivious to the player's presence, lost in his reverie.
Player: Nice form. Where'd you learn to dance like that?
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Wyll does a few more turns and steps, than faces the player and smiles.
Wyll: I've attended my share of fancy balls and masquerades. A few elegant moves can turn all the right heads.
Wyll: Figured it was time to brush up on my skills. I wouldn't want to fail my new partner.
Wyll: I need them to be just right. I wouldn't want to fail my new partner.
Player: Trust me. I don't think you could fail anyone if you tried.
Wyll: I know a few people who might beg to differ. But the only one that matters is here with me now.
Wyll: May I have this dance?
Player: Dance? But there's no music.
Wyll: Our hearts can keep time.
Wyll: But I count you as a friend. My closest, in all honesty. Please - dance with me. If we must burn with the Hells' fires, let us burn together.
Player: I'm ready - let's dance.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Player smiles and bows, taking Wyll's hand. Wyll turns guiding the player into the the center of the imaginary dance floor he was using to practice at the start of the scene.

Wyll releases the player's hand, and the two assume courtly posture oppsite eachother.

Wyll releases the player's hand, and the two assume courtly posture oppsite eachother.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Wyll stomps, assuming a paso doble stance. Perfect lines. Intense. He takes a few rhythmic steps foward, playfully invading the player's space while maintaining eye contact.
Player: Twirl about with flair and abandon.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Player starts to twirl but then stumbles and takes a moment to straighten themselves out.
Wyll: Ha ha - ahem. Don't you worry. It takes years to master the Vollante.
Player: You're a beautiful dancer. I'm sure you'll teach me in no time.
Wyll: I'll show you everything I know, and then some - I promise.
Wyll: But perhaps we might try a more intimate style.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Wyll begins a slower dance and the player follows suit.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: The players come closer together until their lips are a hair away of touching.
Player: Invite him closer with a knowing look - it's what you both want.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Wyll pushes his lips against the player's, then pulls away.
Wyll: So much shadow around us. To think I almost missed the light.
Wyll: Well - it's getting late. We can't face the morrow if we don't bid farewell to the now.
Player: Move in for another kiss.
Wyll: *Sigh.* I've drunk wines from Daggerford to Cormyr, but I've never known a taste as rich as yours.
Wyll: Gods damn it. You almost make me forget myself.
Wyll: But I still keep faith in the old tales of love, the once-upon-a-times and the happily-ever-afters.
Wyll: I'd like to do this the proper way. The way of the old romances sung by the bards.
Wyll: Till next time, good night - and dream sweetly.

Wyll: Ah, but enough reflection for today. I'm of a mind to celebrate.

Zevlor: Forgive that display. Aradin's a blowhard, but that's no cause for me to join him.
Zevlor: Thank you for your help out there. I'm Zevlor.
Zevlor: And if I'm not mistaken, you're the Blade of Frontiers.
Player: Please - it's just Wyll.
Zevlor: Well met, by whatever name. Though I'm afraid that's all the welcome we can give you.
Zevlor: Whatever your business, I'd see to it quickly - the druids are forcing everyone out.
Zevlor: This attack will only strengthen their resolve.
Player: Why are they forcing you out?
Zevlor: There have been several attacks by different monsters. The druids blame us 'outsiders' for drawing them here. Nobody's welcome anymore.
Zevlor: They've started a ritual to cut the grove off from the world outside.
Zevlor: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
Player: What brought you here?
Zevlor: We're refugees from Elturel - we took shelter here after gnolls attacked us on the road.
Zevlor: We were bound for Baldur's Gate, and it was too late to turn back. Elturel had no place for tieflings after the Descent.
Karlach: Gods, these are those tiefs? Their whole city was dragged into Avernus for a while. Zariel was delighted. When they made it back out, I'd hoped they got their happy ending.
Narrator: *'The Descent' - an infernal conspiracy that had seen the entire city of Elturel briefly dragged to the Hells.*
Player: Maybe your people should have stayed in Hell.
Karlach: Excuse you.
Zevlor: It seems you're of a mind with our hosts here. But their ritual will force you out, too.
Zevlor: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
Player: This ritual - is there no way to convince the druids to stop it?
Zevlor: I've tried. Kagha - their new First Druid - won't even see me.
Zevlor: You, though... I know it's not your business, but she owes you for saving this place.
Zevlor: Perhaps you could persuade her. For more time to prepare, if nothing else.
Player: I have my own temporal concerns. I need a healer.
Player: I'll find her. And I'll speak to Kagha while I'm there.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The player approaches Wyll. Wyll is practing his dance moves, oblivious to the player's presence, lost in his reverie.
Player: Nice form. Where'd you learn to dance like that?
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Wyll does a few more turns and steps, than faces the player and smiles.
Wyll: I've attended my share of fancy balls and masquerades. A few elegant moves can turn all the right heads.
Wyll: Figured it was time to brush up on my skills. I wouldn't want to fail my new partner.
Wyll: I need them to be just right. I wouldn't want to fail my new partner.
Player: Keep practising. I'm sure you'll get better... eventually...
Wyll: Maybe. But I'm not so keen to perform solo. A duet's always been more my style. Which is to say -
Wyll: May I have this dance?
Player: Cocky, don't you think? Threaten my life, then try to cosy up after?
Wyll: I deserve that. And I wish I could give more than 'sorry's in return.
Wyll: But I count you as a friend. My closest, in all honesty. Please - dance with me. If we must burn with the Hells' fires, let us burn together.
Player: I'm ready - let's dance.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Player smiles and bows, taking Wyll's hand. Wyll turns guiding the player into the the center of the imaginary dance floor he was using to practice at the start of the scene.

Wyll releases the player's hand, and the two assume courtly posture oppsite eachother.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: Wyll stomps, assuming a paso doble stance. Perfect lines. Intense. He takes a few rhythmic steps foward, playfully invading the player's space while maintaining eye contact.
Player: Gather your strength and leap into the air.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Player leaps into the air, but then stumbles, rights themselves, and smiles at Wyll.
Wyll: Ha ha - ahem. Don't you worry. It takes years to master the Vollante.
Player: You're a beautiful dancer. I'm sure you'll teach me in no time.
Wyll: I'll show you everything I know, and then some - I promise.
Wyll: But perhaps we might try a more intimate style.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Wyll begins a slower dance and the player follows suit.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: The players come closer together until their lips are a hair away of touching.
Player: Invite him closer with a knowing look - it's what you both want.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Wyll pushes his lips against the player's, then pulls away.
Wyll: So much shadow around us. To think I almost missed the light.
Wyll: Well - it's getting late. We can't face the morrow if we don't bid farewell to the now.
Player: Good night, Wyll.
Wyll: Good night. And thank you. For the dance, I mean. I won't forget it.

Duke Ulder Ravengard: The Absolute's voice is gone, but I still hear its echoes - reflections of reflections.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: As you wish.

Duke Ulder Ravengard: A terrible fate for Ansur, my son. Yet my hopes for the city's future have never been higher.
Narrator: *Uncertainty fills the air. You have reached a fork in your path. In which direction will you travel?*
Player: What makes you so sure the people will welcome me as a duke?
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I will tell the citizens and the patriars of your good works. They will know you carry your father's banner.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: But it is true - you are still under the she-devil's thumb...
Narrator: *Uncertainty fills the air. Wyll has reached a fork in his path. In which direction will he travel?*
Player: Become a Grand Duke. Imagine the power you'll wield.
Wyll: Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. These were the lessons my father taught me.
Wyll: Baldur's Gate is my home, and I am its servant. I will be relentless in my pursuit of the greatest good.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I would sooner die by Mizora's hand than let her endanger the city. I'll figure out a way.
Wyll: The Blade of Frontiers is no more. I will be Wyll Ravengard, son of Ulder, proud Duke of Baldur's Gate.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My son! Together, there is no army we cannot conquer and no wrong we cannot right.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Hail Duke Wyll Ravengard!
Minsc: Duke Wyll Ravengard!
Narrator: *Wyll's courage and enthusiasm warms the air. With him at your side, the road ahead doesn't look so insurmountable.*

[description] CinematicNodeContext: # Mizora's Exit sequence #
Wyll: Holy hells.
Player: Get on with it, Mizora. What can you do about Ravengard?
Wyll: Shit.
Mizora: Your father is dead, Wyll. The Dead Three have claimed their prize.
Wyll: Dead? Godsdamn wretches!
Mizora: Still yourself, pup. Not every death is forever.
Mizora: Sisters.
Arbiter Cirrus: Infernus contractus te vocamus. Infernus contractus te vocamus. Infernus contractus te vocamus.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: A contract appears in the air, glowing. It is Wyll's contract.
Mizora: Your contract, Wyll. Signed in blood, forged in fire, bound in bone - but not unbreakable.
Player: Remain silent.
Mizora: Yet no contract is ended without sacrifice, Wyll. The cost must be paid.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Flames ignite Mizora and her two companions. Mizora's voice echos outward as if amplified by the Hells themselves.
Mizora: Wyll Ravengard. A choice is before you.
Mizora: Option one. I show you the way to your father. I guarantee him no harm except that from you and your allies. And you pledge your soul to me and the archdevil Zariel in a pact eternal.
Mizora: Option two. I break your pact. You are freed from your duty but retain your devil form. Your father dies by his enemy's hand.
Mizora: Name your sacrifice.
Karlach: Bloody Zariel. I won't let her take Wyll!
Mizora: Silence, Karlach!
Wyll: Mizora, you arsehole.
Mizora: Choose.
Player: Break the pact, Wyll. You deserve your freedom.

Raphael: There. Middle-of-somewhere.
Karlach: I don't like this at all.
Player: Reach for your weapon.
Raphael: Tut tut. No need for that crude cutlery of yours. As you can see, I'm amply provisioned.
NodeContext: He gestures across the table: plenty of silverware present.
Raphael: This is the House of Hope. Where the tired come to rest, and the famished come to feed - lavishly.
Raphael: Go on. Partake. Enjoy your supper. After all...
Raphael: ...it might just be your last.
Player: Are these theatrics leading somewhere?
Raphael: Are you not entertained? Well - far be it from me to disappoint.
Raphael: What's better than a devil you don't know?
Raphael: A devil you do.
Wyll: Hollering hells - you're a cambion.
Raphael: And so much more.
Raphael: Am I a friend? Potentially. An adversary? Conceivably. But a saviour? That's for certain.
Player: Why would you help me?
Raphael: Because my compassion is boundless. I stride among the needy, giving comfort where I can.
Raphael: And you're in dire need. One skull, two tenants, and no solution in sight.
Raphael: I could fix it all like that.
NodeContext: He snaps his fingers on the word 'that'. As he does so, the candle flames suddenly shine unnaturally bright, bathing the scene in a hellish red glow.
Player: You're mad if you think I'll make a deal with a devil.

Duke Ulder Ravengard: My friend, I -
Narrator: *The world spins as Ravengard's dizziness flows into you.*
GROUP_Emperors: His mind is his own, but the elder brain touched him deeper than most. He must stay here - he will need time to recover.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: The voice is gone, but I still hear its echoes - reflections of reflections.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Godsdamned Gortash - he'll suffer for this. I'll drive Balduran's sword straight through his belly.
Player: Gortash is done for. It was a long time coming.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: So the bastard's gone? A shame I never... ngh...
Narrator: *Your parasites link. Pain splits your head, and you hear a distant voice, a whisper of a memory. It calls for you. All of you...*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I saw your mind. That thing's still in me - and there's one in you. I don't understand.
GROUP_Emperors: Relax your mind. I will show him.
Player: Let the Emperor reveal your memories.
Narrator: *Ravengard gasps as his thoughts consume yours. He sees everything - the nautiloid journey, the perilous path to Moonrise, the Astral Prism, and the Emperor within.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: By the Hells, my life hinges on a mind flayer's whim, and Baldur's Gate hangs from its talons.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: It seems the fate of the city lies in your hands.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Please - promise that you'll be the shield that defends, the sword that slays, and the hammer that rebuilds. Be our champion.
Player: I will defeat the Absolute and defend this great city. You have my word.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: May the Triad guide you.
Player: Let's talk more, shall we?
Duke Ulder Ravengard: As you wish.
Player: Florrick is free. She's gathering allies as we speak.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Tremendous news. She proves as loyal to you as she is to me.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I couldn't bear it if she died by my command. May the Triad guide her steps.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: As you wish.
Player: Tell him about your battle with Ansur.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: A terrible fate for Ansur, my son. Yet my hopes for the city's future have never been higher.
Wyll: I failed, father. The wyrm is fallen.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: A terrible fate for Ansur, my son. Yet my hopes for the city's future have never been higher.
Wyll: I don't understand.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You and your allies slayed the undead terror that was once the great Ansur. You are stronger than even the great wyrm.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You will be the one to part the storms and lead the people through. You, not Ansur, are the saviour we need.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: First, you will fell the Absolute. Then, we will rebuild Baldur's Gate, we will take back our city - together.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I will name you Baldur's Gate's newest Grand Duke of the Council. You will be hailed Heart of the Gate.
Wyll: Grand Duke? I look the part of a fiend.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I will tell the citizens and the patriars of your good works. They will know you carry your father's banner.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: But it is true - you are still under the she-devil's thumb...
Narrator: *Uncertainty fills the air. Wyll has reached a fork in his path. In which direction will he travel?*
Player: Become a Grand Duke. Imagine the power you'll wield.
Wyll: Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. These were the lessons my father taught me.
Wyll: Baldur's Gate is my home, and I am its servant. I will be relentless in my pursuit of the greatest good.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I would sooner die by Mizora's hand than let her endanger the city. I'll figure out a way.
Wyll: The Blade of Frontiers is no more. I will be Wyll Ravengard, son of Ulder, proud Duke of Baldur's Gate.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My son! Together, there is no army we cannot conquer and no wrong we cannot right.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Hail Duke Wyll Ravengard!
Karlach: Duke Wyll Ravengard!
Narrator: *Wyll's courage and enthusiasm warms the air. With him at your side, the road ahead doesn't look so insurmountable.*

Narrator: *Your tadpole resonates with Ravengard's. The exhausted Grand Duke is a flurry of emotion - gratitude and relief, anger and deep pain.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: W-Wyll? It - it can't be. By Balduran's graces, have you fallen so far that Avernus has taken you?
Duke Ulder Ravengard: First you cleave my heart in twain. Now you shatter it into pieces.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My own son, still the she-devil's toy. Is this my fate - to rise from death into a hell of my own boy's making?
Wyll: It isn't what you think. It never was.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You turned your back on me, on your city, to chase the she-devil and her power. She stinks up this place even now.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: It is exactly what I think.
Player: Your son sacrificed his soul to save yours. He had no choice.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: There is always a choice.
Wyll: Father, please - there's something I must show you.
Narrator: *Ravengard's tadpole clenches as your memories - and Wyll's - flow into him.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: By Tyr's wounds - I'm in your mind...
Narrator: *The Grand Duke sees Mizora and her infernal sisters. He sees the agony in Wyll's face as an impossible choice is set before him.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: No. My son -
Narrator: *The past becomes present, and Wyll's thoughts are laid bare. Ravengard sees Wyll partnering with Mizora to defeat Tiamat's cultists before they could lay siege to Baldur's Gate.*
Narrator: *And he sees everything beyond. The nautiloid journey, the perilous path to Moonrise, the Astral Prism, and the Emperor within.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Wyll.
Wyll: Everything I did, I did for Baldur's Gate. I did for you.
Player: Say nothing.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My son, you sold your soul to save Baldur's Gate - and I cast you out for it.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You gave yourself to the Hells' eternal fires so I might walk free.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: By the gods, can you ever forgive me?
Wyll: There's nothing to forgive. You wanted to protect the city. I only ever wanted the same.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You are a better man than most, and a better son than I deserve. I'll yet make amends, but -
Duke Ulder Ravengard: - my duty is first and foremost to the city and its people. There's something I must ask of you.
Player: Go on.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Before I was captured, I was on a mission.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Returning from Elturel, I discovered the plans of the Absolutists. I immediately realised the city couldn't defend itself against such an army.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I didn't despair because the city has a secret guardian, a wyrm that sleeps beneath. He can be called upon in times of great need.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: This is such a time. You've been trained in the ways of the great champions and proven to be one of them. The wyrm will answer your call. You must seek him out.
Player: A wyrm? Are you saying there's a dragon living under the city?
Duke Ulder Ravengard: A bronze dragon, yes. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Since then, the city has faced countless threats, but we always overcame. There was never a need to call on the wyrm - until now.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: The Absolute is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. The wyrm must be awakened - and the task falls to you.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Take this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Let it set the path before you.
Player: Your faith in Wyll is well-founded. We will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The player walks toward their bedroll/sleeping area.
Narrator: *You are enveloped in myriad sensations, all at once. Flaming desire and icy despair; the strength of iron and the haze of thick swamp mist.*
Mizora: The Nine Hells of Baator. The ultimate torment, some souls would say.
Mizora: Tsk. Those souls lack imagination.
Player: What's happening? What are you doing to me?
Mizora: I'm going to show you the true wages of your sin.

Mizora: You feel it, don't you? Primal hunger, irrepressible decadence. Forget the heavens - this is paradise.
Mizora: Let me show you.
Player: I can take it.
Mizora: I know you can, sister. You know just how much the Hells can hurt.
Narrator: *An inferno engulfs you. Your lust blazes hot.*
Mizora: Do you feel it? Avernus. Where Hells' legions march, screaming their rage. Where the Styx collects the blood of the fallen.
Mizora: Where your rightful mistress shoulders the burdens of perpetual war.
Mizora: Reach out. Have a taste.
Player: Gorge on the River of Blood. Relish its flavour.
Narrator: *The flavour is exquisite as spiced wine, terrible as rotting offal. It does not quench your lust - it only stokes it.*

The player makes a fist, the flame extinguishes, but in doing so a new flood of sensation rushes into their core. Their back and neck arch slightly as they breath deep.
Mizora: Don't worry, pet. I won't leave 'til you're fully satisfied.
Mizora: Dis, the blackened elysium. Minauros, the rotting bog. The molten seas and soil of Phlegethos. Stygia, the frozen ocean.
Mizora: Choose a Hell. Have your fill.
Player: The icy seas of Stygia.
Narrator: *You are immersed in a cold ocean blanketed by twilight. Lightning strikes you, energising and illuminating. Now that you know the thrill of its shock, you yearn for more.*

The player extends both arms out toward the flames, palms down. Their eyes close as they connect with Mizora's hellish offerings.

She watches as the pleasure rides out the sensations.
InternalNodeContext: Cannot be aliased due to VFX coloration and narration, anims resued though.

Mizora: One last choice, and starve no longer.
Mizora: Malbolge, the desolation. The forgotten ruins of Maladomini. Cania and its mountains of ice. Or Nessus, the seat of infernal power.
Player: Malbolge, craggy and cavernous.

Wyll: I failed, father. The wyrm is fallen.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: A terrible fate for Ansur, my son. Yet my hopes for the city's future have never been higher.
Wyll: I don't understand.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You and your allies slayed the undead terror that was once the great Ansur. You are stronger than even the great wyrm.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You will be the one to part the storms and lead the people through. You, not Ansur, are the saviour we need.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: First, you will fell the Absolute. Then, we will rebuild Baldur's Gate, we will take back our city - together.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I will name you Baldur's Gate's newest Grand Duke of the Council. You will be hailed Heart of the Gate.
Wyll: Grand Duke? I look the part of a fiend. A half-devil possesses my very soul.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I will tell the citizens and the patriars of your good works. They will know you carry your father's banner.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: But it is true - you are still under the she-devil's thumb...
Narrator: *Uncertainty fills the air. Wyll has reached a fork in his path. In which direction will he travel?*
Player: Become a Grand Duke. Imagine the power you'll wield.
Wyll: Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. These were the lessons my father taught me.
Wyll: Baldur's Gate is my home, and I am its servant. I will be relentless in my pursuit of the greatest good.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I would sooner die by Mizora's hand than let her endanger the city. I'll figure out a way.
Wyll: The Blade of Frontiers is no more. I will be Wyll Ravengard, son of Ulder, proud Duke of Baldur's Gate.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My son! Together, there is no army we cannot conquer and no wrong we cannot right.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Hail Duke Wyll Ravengard!
Gale: Duke Wyll Ravengard!
Narrator: *Wyll's courage and enthusiasm warms the air. With him at your side, the road ahead doesn't look so insurmountable.*

Duke Ulder Ravengard: First you cleave my heart in twain. Now you shatter it into pieces.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My own son, still the she-devil's toy. Is this my fate - to rise from death into a hell of my own boy's making?
Wyll: It isn't what you think. It never was.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You turned your back on me, on your city, to chase the she-devil and her power. She stinks up this place even now.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: It is exactly what I think.
Player: Your son sacrificed his soul to save yours. He had no choice.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: There is always a choice.
Wyll: Father, please - there's something I must show you.
Narrator: *Ravengard's tadpole clenches as your memories - and Wyll's - flow into him.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: By Tyr's wounds - I'm in your mind...
Narrator: *The Grand Duke sees Mizora and her infernal sisters. He sees the agony in Wyll's face as an impossible choice is set before him.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: No. My son -
Narrator: *The past becomes present, and Wyll's thoughts are laid bare. Ravengard sees Wyll partnering with Mizora to defeat Tiamat's cultists before they could lay siege to Baldur's Gate.*
Narrator: *And he sees everything beyond. The nautiloid journey, the perilous path to Moonrise, the Astral Prism, and the Emperor within.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Wyll.
Wyll: Everything I did, I did for Baldur's Gate. I did for you.
Player: Heh. I bet you feel like a real bastard right about now.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I do. And I should.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My son, you sold your soul to save Baldur's Gate - and I cast you out for it.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You gave yourself to the Hells' eternal fires so I might walk free.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: By the gods, can you ever forgive me?
Wyll: There's nothing to forgive. You wanted to protect the city. I only ever wanted the same.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You are a better man than most, and a better son than I deserve. I'll yet make amends, but -
Duke Ulder Ravengard: - my duty is first and foremost to the city and its people. There's something I must ask of you.
Player: Go on.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Before I was captured, I was on a mission.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Returning from Elturel, I discovered the plans of the Absolutists. I immediately realised the city couldn't defend itself against such an army.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I didn't despair because the city has a secret guardian, a wyrm that sleeps beneath. He can be called upon in times of great need.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: This is such a time. You've been trained in the ways of the great champions and proven to be one of them. The wyrm will answer your call. You must seek him out.
Player: Waking a dragon doesn't sound like a good idea.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: This is no ordinary dragon.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Since then, the city has faced countless threats, but we always overcame. There was never a need to call on the wyrm - until now.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: The Absolute is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. The wyrm must be awakened - and the task falls to you.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Take this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Let it set the path before you.
Player: Wyll? What do you make of this?

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The player approaches Wyll. Wyll is practing his dance moves, oblivious to the player's presence, lost in his reverie.
Player: It's like watching a beached flounder flop back to the sea. Is that the idea?
Wyll: Oh goodness. Is it all that bad? I'm dreadfully out of practise.
Wyll: No better time to brush up on my skills, then. It would do me no good to fail my new partner.
Wyll: I need them to be just right. I wouldn't want to fail my new partner.
Player: A new partner? And who might that be?
Wyll: As luck would have it, they just arrived.
Wyll: May I have this dance?
Player: I'd like to, but I'm afraid I'll trip over my own feet.
Wyll: Don't worry. It's not really about the dance. It's about who's we're dancing with.
Wyll: But I count you as a friend. My closest, in all honesty. Please - dance with me. If we must burn with the Hells' fires, let us burn together.
Player: I'm ready - let's dance.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Player smiles and bows, taking Wyll's hand. Wyll turns guiding the player into the the center of the imaginary dance floor he was using to practice at the start of the scene.

Wyll releases the player's hand, and the two assume courtly posture oppsite eachother.

Wyll releases the player's hand, and the two assume courtly posture oppsite eachother.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Wyll stomps, assuming a paso doble stance. Perfect lines. Intense. He takes a few rhythmic steps foward, playfully invading the player's space while maintaining eye contact.
Player: Gather your strength and leap into the air.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Player leaps gracefully into the air and lands with aplomb.
Wyll: Bravo. Bravo!
Player: Smile nervously.
Wyll: No need to be modest, you were a delight to behold.
Wyll: Now perhaps we might try a more - intimate style.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Wyll begins a slower dance and the player follows suit.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: The players come closer together until their lips are a hair away of touching.
Player: Invite him closer with a knowing look - it's what you both want.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Wyll pushes his lips against the player's, then pulls away.
Wyll: So much shadow around us. To think I almost missed the light.
Wyll: Well - it's getting late. We can't face the morrow if we don't bid farewell to the now.
Player: Move in for another kiss.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: The player kisses Wyll - he kisses back, then pulls away.
Wyll: *Sigh.* I've drunk wines from Daggerford to Cormyr, but I've never known a taste as rich as yours.
Wyll: Gods damn it. You almost make me forget myself.
Wyll: But I still keep faith in the old tales of love, the once-upon-a-times and the happily-ever-afters.
Wyll: I'd like to do this the proper way. The way of the old romances sung by the bards.
Wyll: Till next time, good night - and dream sweetly.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The player approaches Wyll. Wyll is practing his dance moves, oblivious to the player's presence, lost in his reverie.
Player: Stay quiet, and watch Wyll dance.
Wyll: Oh! Sorry. I didn't see you standing there. Lost in the steps, truth be told.
Wyll: I need them to be just right. I wouldn't want to fail my new partner.
Player: A new partner? And who might that be?
Wyll: As luck would have it, they just arrived.
Wyll: May I have this dance?
Player: Wyll, I'd love nothing more than to dance with you. But I fear I'd burn you to a crisp.
Wyll: About that. You only burn hottest when your emotions are aflare, right? Anger, excitement, fear... but a dance can be meditative. Calming.
Wyll: If you think you can put your hand in mine without singeing it off, I'm willing to try.
Player: I could try. If you're up for it.
Wyll: It would be an honour.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Player smiles and bows, taking Wyll's hand. Wyll turns guiding the player into the the center of the imaginary dance floor he was using to practice at the start of the scene.

Wyll releases the player's hand, and the two assume courtly posture oppsite eachother.

Wyll releases the player's hand, and the two assume courtly posture oppsite eachother.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Wyll stomps, assuming a paso doble stance. Perfect lines. Intense. He takes a few rhythmic steps foward, playfully invading the player's space while maintaining eye contact.
Player: Perform a simple cadence.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Player performs a simple dance move and smiles at Wyll.
Wyll: Bravo. Bravo!
Player: It wasn't hard. You just make it look hard.
Wyll: Indeed? Well let's see how you fare with a more - intimate style.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Wyll begins a slower dance and the player follows suit.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: The players come closer together until their lips are a hair away of touching.
Player: Turn your head away.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Wyll and the player step away from each other. After an awkward moment, he smiles.
Wyll: Well - it's getting late. We can't face the morrow if we don't bid farewell to the now.
Player: Good night, Wyll.
Wyll: Good night. And thank you. For the dance, I mean. I won't forget it.

Raphael: There. Middle-of-somewhere.
Karlach: I don't like this at all.
Player: Can you be more specific than 'somewhere'?
Raphael: The House of Hope. Where the tired come to rest, and the famished come to feed - lavishly.
NodeContext: He spreads his arms as he dramatically introduces this place.
Raphael: Go on. Partake. Enjoy your supper. After all...
Raphael: ...it might just be your last.
Player: We're in the Hells, aren't we. Take me back. Now.
Raphael: Are you not entertained? Well - far be it from me to disappoint.
Raphael: What's better than a devil you don't know?
Raphael: A devil you do.
Karlach: Fuck. A cambion.
Raphael: And so much more.
Raphael: Am I a friend? Potentially. An adversary? Conceivably. But a saviour? That's for certain.
Player: Why would you help me?
Raphael: Because my compassion is boundless. I stride among the needy, giving comfort where I can.
Raphael: And you're in dire need. One skull, two tenants, and no solution in sight.
Raphael: I could fix it all like that.
NodeContext: He snaps his fingers on the word 'that'. As he does so, the candle flames suddenly shine unnaturally bright, bathing the scene in a hellish red glow.
Player: You're mad if you think I'll make a deal with a devil.

Zevlor: You acted quickly. I'm just sorry I didn't get there first.
Zevlor: Forgive that display. Aradin's a blowhard, but that's no cause for me to join him.
Zevlor: Thank you for your help out there. I'm Zevlor.
Zevlor: And if I'm not mistaken, you're the Blade of Frontiers.
Player: Please - it's just Wyll.
Zevlor: Well met, by whatever name. Though I'm afraid that's all the welcome we can give you.
Zevlor: Whatever your business, I'd see to it quickly - the druids are forcing everyone out.
Zevlor: This attack will only strengthen their resolve.
Player: I have no quarrel with druids.
Zevlor: There have been several attacks by different monsters. The druids blame us 'outsiders' for drawing them here. Nobody's welcome anymore.
Zevlor: They've started a ritual to cut the grove off from the world outside.
Zevlor: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
Player: What brought you here?
Zevlor: We're refugees from Elturel - we took shelter here after gnolls attacked us on the road.
Zevlor: We were bound for Baldur's Gate, and it was too late to turn back. Elturel had no place for tieflings after the Descent.
Narrator: *You remember it. Elturel and all its citizens were dragged into Avernus - then back out again.*
Player: Found sanctuary here, did you?
Zevlor: So I hoped. But we've lost so many already - and more will die if we're forced out again.
Zevlor: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
Player: What brought you here?
Zevlor: We're refugees from Elturel - we took shelter here after gnolls attacked us on the road.
Zevlor: We were bound for Baldur's Gate, and it was too late to turn back. Elturel had no place for tieflings after the Descent.
Karlach: Gods, these are those tiefs? Their whole city was dragged into Avernus for a while. Zariel was delighted. When they made it back out, I'd hoped they got their happy ending.
Narrator: *'The Descent' - an infernal conspiracy that had seen the entire city of Elturel briefly dragged to the Hells.*
Player: Is there a place for tieflings anywhere?
Zevlor: Hah - a fair point. We can only hope the citizens of Baldur's Gate are more open-minded.
Zevlor: But we can't get there with those beasts blocking our path.
Zevlor: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
Player: This ritual - is there no way to convince the druids to stop it?
Zevlor: I've tried. Kagha - their new First Druid - won't even see me.
Zevlor: You, though... I know it's not your business, but she owes you for saving this place.
Zevlor: Perhaps you could persuade her. For more time to prepare, if nothing else.
Player: I have my own temporal concerns. I need a healer.
Player: I'll find her. And I'll speak to Kagha while I'm there.

Lae'zel: 'The Blade of Frontiers.' One might think you finished where you started.
Wyll: An old name, for certain. But a new man to bear it.
Wyll: The four pillars finally rise within me. Courage, Insight, strategy, justice.
Wyll: I'm not to abide them, but to become them.
Wyll: A hero is not just - he is justice. He is not courageous - he is courage.
Wyll: Ah, but enough reflection for today. I'm of a mind to celebrate.
Player: Eh, I'll leave you to it.
Player: What are your plans as the Blade, once the brain is defeated?
Wyll: I scout both the Hells and the Coast's havens. And I destroy every fiend that dares put its eye on Faerûn.
Player: There's more to your plans than you're letting on, isn't there?
Wyll: *Sigh* Yes. There is.
Wyll: I will be hunting Mizora.
Wyll: I won't let her claim one more soul, slay one more victim. I'm going to make my way to the Hells and tear the horns right off her damned head.
Player: You need to destroy her. She doesn't deserve any better.
Wyll: Damn right. I'll cut her to ribbons before she can so much as groan Zariel's name.
Player: What are your plans as the Blade, once the brain is defeated?
Wyll: I do what I do best. Answering the calls of the needful, killing the monsters that haunt them -
Wyll: - and showing them they won't be abandoned.
Player: What are your plans as the Blade, once the brain is defeated? What about us?
Wyll: I love the Coast, I love its people. The Blade of Avernus will toil for them...
Wyll: ... but he'd rather not toil alone.
Wyll: Faerûn doesn't need just one hero. It needs two. Say you'll fight with me.
Player: Nothing would make me happier.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The player kisses Wyll - he kisses back, then pulls away.
Wyll: *Sigh.* I've drunk wines from Daggerford to Cormyr, but I've never known a taste as rich as yours.
Wyll: Gods damn it. You almost make me forget myself.
Wyll: But I still keep faith in the old tales of love, the once-upon-a-times and the happily-ever-afters.
Wyll: I'd like to do this the proper way. The way of the old romances sung by the bards.
Wyll: Till next time, good night - and dream sweetly.

Zevlor: Ngh. Mragreshem.
NodeContext: mrag-RESH-em. Means 'shithead' in infernal. Zevlor has just woken up after being punched in the face by Aradin. He's groggy and pissed off.
Zevlor: A cheap shot. I should've expected that.
NodeContext: Disgust in his voice. His idiot enemy clocked him.
Player: Are you all right?
Zevlor: I'll survive a sore jaw. Particularly if it's rid the grove of Aradin.
Zevlor: Whatever your business, I'd see to it quickly - the druids are forcing everyone out.
Zevlor: This attack will only strengthen their resolve.
Player: Why are they forcing you out?
Zevlor: There have been several attacks by different monsters. The druids blame us 'outsiders' for drawing them here. Nobody's welcome anymore.
Zevlor: They've started a ritual to cut the grove off from the world outside.
Zevlor: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
Player: What brought you here?
Zevlor: We're refugees from Elturel - we took shelter here after gnolls attacked us on the road.
Zevlor: We were bound for Baldur's Gate, and it was too late to turn back. Elturel had no place for tieflings after the Descent.
Player: You made it back from Avernus. Surely you can survive anything?
Zevlor: So I hoped. But we've lost so many already - and more will die if we're forced out again.
Zevlor: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
Player: What brought you here?
Zevlor: We're refugees from Elturel - we took shelter here after gnolls attacked us on the road.
Zevlor: We were bound for Baldur's Gate, and it was too late to turn back. Elturel had no place for tieflings after the Descent.
Player: 'The Descent'? What is that?
Zevlor: I'm surprised you haven't heard of it.
Zevlor: The High Overseer - our grand protector - signed a pact with devils. It dragged Elturel straight to Hell.
Zevlor: Lucky for us, a group of adventurers found a way to bring the city back.
Zevlor: Afterwards, people looked at us and just saw 'devilkin'. No different from the druids here, really.
Zevlor: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
Player: This ritual - is there no way to convince the druids to stop it?
Zevlor: I've tried. Kagha - their new First Druid - won't even see me.
Zevlor: You, though... I know it's not your business, but she owes you for saving this place.
Zevlor: Perhaps you could persuade her. For more time to prepare, if nothing else.
Player: I have my own temporal concerns. I need a healer.
Player: I'll find her. And I'll speak to Kagha while I'm there.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The player walks toward their bedroll/sleeping area.
Narrator: *You are enveloped in myriad sensations, all at once. Flaming desire and icy despair; the strength of iron and the haze of thick swamp mist.*
Mizora: The Nine Hells of Baator. The ultimate torment, some souls would say.
Mizora: Tsk. Those souls lack imagination.
Player: I'm not so sure about this, Mizora.
Mizora: A banquet lies before you. Why should you not gorge?
Player: What exactly will this entail?
Mizora: I'm going to show you the true wages of your sin.
Narrator: *Pure lust courses through your veins and plucks at your flesh. You don't know what you want, only that you want it.*
Mizora: You feel it, don't you? Primal hunger, irrepressible decadence. Forget the heavens - this is paradise.
Mizora: Let me show you.
Player: Sigh and brace yourself.
Mizora: What's the matter. Don't you trust me?
Narrator: *An inferno engulfs you. Your lust blazes hot.*
Mizora: Do you feel it? Avernus. Where Hells' legions march, screaming their rage. Where the Styx collects the blood of the fallen.
Mizora: Where your rightful mistress shoulders the burdens of perpetual war.
Mizora: Reach out. Have a taste.
Player: Take a tentative sip.
Narrator: *A touch of bitter nips at your tongue. It is vile, it is luscious - apples and ashes, fresh honey and bonedust. You ache for another taste.*

JLatino: We have a breath deep construction anim, use that
Mizora: Don't worry, pet. I won't leave 'til you're fully satisfied.
Mizora: Dis, the blackened elysium. Minauros, the rotting bog. The molten seas and soil of Phlegethos. Stygia, the frozen ocean.
Mizora: Choose a Hell. Have your fill.
Player: The icy seas of Stygia.
Narrator: *You are immersed in a cold ocean blanketed by twilight. Lightning strikes you, energising and illuminating. Now that you know the thrill of its shock, you yearn for more.*

Wyll: 'The Blade of Avernus.' A new name for a changed man.
Wyll: Ah, but enough reflection for today. I'm of a mind to celebrate.
Player: Sounds heavenly.
Wyll: Wonderful. You hunt the deer, I'll scrounge up the ale. Prepare your belly for roast a la Blade!
Player: There's more to your plans than you're letting on, isn't there?
Wyll: *Sigh* Yes. There is.
Wyll: I will be hunting Mizora.
Wyll: I won't let her claim one more soul, slay one more victim. I'm going to make my way to the Hells and tear the horns right off her damned head.
Player: Let it go, Wyll. There are better ways to help the people of the Sword Coast.
Wyll: I can't let it go.
Wyll: I will return to Avernus. And I'll cut Mizora to ribbons before she can so much as groan Zariel's name.
Player: What are your plans as the Blade, once the brain is defeated? What about us?
Wyll: I love the Coast, I love its people. The Blade of Avernus will toil for them...
Wyll: ... but he'd rather not toil alone.
Wyll: Faerûn doesn't need just one hero. It needs two. Say you'll fight with me.
Player: Nothing would make me happier.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The player walks toward their bedroll/sleeping area.
Narrator: *You are enveloped in myriad sensations, all at once. Flaming desire and icy despair; the strength of iron and the haze of thick swamp mist.*
Mizora: The Nine Hells of Baator. The ultimate torment, some souls would say.
Mizora: Tsk. Those souls lack imagination.
Player: What's happening? What are you doing to me?
Mizora: I'm going to show you the true wages of your sin.
Narrator: *Pure lust courses through your veins and plucks at your flesh. You don't know what you want, only that you want it.*
Mizora: You feel it, don't you? Primal hunger, irrepressible decadence. Forget the heavens - this is paradise.
Mizora: Let me show you.
Player: Whatever you're offering, I want none of it.

Player: Go on.
Player: A wyrm? Are you saying there's a dragon living under the city?
Duke Ulder Ravengard: A bronze dragon, yes. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Since then, the city has faced countless threats, but we always overcame. There was never a need to call on the wyrm - until now.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: The Absolute is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. The wyrm must be awakened - and the task falls to you.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Take this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Let it set the path before you.
Player: Wyll? What do you make of this?
Wyll: I failed, father. The wyrm is fallen.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: A terrible fate for Ansur, my son. Yet my hopes for the city's future have never been higher.
Wyll: I don't understand.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You and your allies slayed the undead terror that was once the great Ansur. You are stronger than even the great wyrm.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You will be the one to part the storms and lead the people through. You, not Ansur, are the saviour we need.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: First, you will fell the Absolute. Then, we will rebuild Baldur's Gate, we will take back our city - together.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I will name you Baldur's Gate's newest Grand Duke of the Council. You will be hailed Heart of the Gate.
Wyll: Grand Duke? My soul lies with the city. But...
Duke Ulder Ravengard: But what, Wyll?
Wyll: I have slain monsters, faced illithids, guarded the helpless. To be a duke - is this the destiny I've awaited? Is the nobility my calling?
Player: A Grand Duke? You can't turn down an offer like that. Think of the power you'll yield.
Wyll: Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. These were the lessons my father taught me.
Wyll: Baldur's Gate is my home, and I am its servant. I will be relentless in my pursuit of the greatest good.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I would sooner die by Mizora's hand than let her endanger the city. I'll figure out a way.
Wyll: The Blade of Frontiers is no more. I will be Wyll Ravengard, son of Ulder, proud Duke of Baldur's Gate.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My son! Together, there is no army we cannot conquer and no wrong we cannot right.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Hail Duke Wyll Ravengard!
Gale: Duke Wyll Ravengard!
Narrator: *Wyll's courage and enthusiasm warms the air. With him at your side, the road ahead doesn't look so insurmountable.*

Duke Ulder Ravengard: First you cleave my heart in twain. Now you shatter it into pieces.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My own son, still the she-devil's toy. Is this my fate - to be freed from Gortash's hell only to be trapped in yours?
Wyll: It isn't what you think. It never was.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You turned your back on me, on your city, to chase the she-devil and her power. She stinks up this place even now.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: It is exactly what I think.
Player: Wyll pulled you from death's grip, and this is how you thank him?
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You want my gratitude? Fine - take your fill. But I will not celebrate this infernal resurrection.
Wyll: Father, please - there's something I must show you.
Narrator: *Ravengard's tadpole clenches as your memories - and Wyll's - flow into him.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: By Tyr's wounds - I'm in your mind...
Narrator: *The Grand Duke sees Mizora and her infernal sisters. He sees the agony in Wyll's face as an impossible choice is set before him.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: No. My son -
Narrator: *The past becomes present, and Wyll's thoughts are laid bare. Ravengard sees Wyll partnering with Mizora to defeat Tiamat's cultists before they could lay siege to Baldur's Gate.*
Narrator: *And he sees everything beyond. The nautiloid journey, the perilous path to Moonrise, the Astral Prism, and the Emperor within.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Wyll.
Wyll: Everything I did, I did for Baldur's Gate. I did for you.
Player: It's time you two made up. We've got a city to save.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: All too right.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My son, you sold your soul to save Baldur's Gate - and I cast you out for it.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You gave yourself to the Hells' eternal fires so I might walk free.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: By the gods, can you ever forgive me?
Wyll: There's nothing to forgive. You wanted to protect the city. I only ever wanted the same.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You are a better man than most, and a better son than I deserve. I'll yet make amends, but -
Duke Ulder Ravengard: - my duty is first and foremost to the city and its people. There's something I must ask of you.
Player: Go on.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Before I was captured, I was on a mission.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Returning from Elturel, I discovered the plans of the Absolutists. I immediately realised the city couldn't defend itself against such an army.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I didn't despair because the city has a secret guardian, a wyrm that sleeps beneath. He can be called upon in times of great need.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: This is such a time. You've been trained in the ways of the great champions and proven to be one of them. The wyrm will answer your call. You must seek him out.
Player: A wyrm? Are you saying there's a dragon living under the city?
Duke Ulder Ravengard: A bronze dragon, yes. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Since then, the city has faced countless threats, but we always overcame. There was never a need to call on the wyrm - until now.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: The Absolute is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. The wyrm must be awakened - and the task falls to you.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I once held a copy, but it was stolen. Find it, let it set the path before you.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Let it set the path before you.
Player: Your faith in Wyll is well-founded. We will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The player approaches Wyll. Wyll is practing his dance moves, oblivious to the player's presence, lost in his reverie.
Player: Stay quiet, and watch Wyll dance.
Wyll: Oh! Sorry. I didn't see you standing there. Lost in the steps, truth be told.
Wyll: I need them to be just right. I wouldn't want to fail my new partner.
Player: Keep practising. I'm sure you'll get better... eventually...
Wyll: Maybe. But I'm not so keen to perform solo. A duet's always been more my style. Which is to say -
Wyll: May I have this dance?
Player: I'd like to, but I'm afraid I'll trip over my own feet.
Wyll: Don't worry. It's not really about the dance. It's about who's we're dancing with.
Wyll: But I count you as a friend. My closest, in all honesty. Please - dance with me. If we must burn with the Hells' fires, let us burn together.
Player: I'm ready - let's dance.

Counsellor Florrick: I can't thank you enough. For getting me out of that damned prison. And for giving me courage when I'd all but run out.
Wyll: It's the least we could do. Your faith in this city should inspire us all.
Counsellor Florrick: A faith passed on by your father. He was ever loyal, even when the skies were darkest.
