Player: Good luck out there. You'll need it.
Counsellor Florrick: Not-so-encouraging words. If we're to crush the Absolute, we need to hold our heads high, and our weapons higher.
Counsellor Florrick: I will travel to the Upper City, find what allies I can.
Counsellor Florrick: You won't fight the coming battle alone. As long as the city stands, I will stand with it. This is my promise.

Barcus Wroot: Well. You... did it!
Barcus Wroot: I shouldn't be surprised, considering our history. And yet...
Player: Don't sound so surprised.
Barcus Wroot: Nothing good happens in the Underdark.
Barcus Wroot: I don't know if you heard, but some of the Ironhand Gnomes - my friend Wulbren among them - have been taken prisoner in Moonrise Towers.
Barcus Wroot: I know someone of your background would fit right in in that heart of horrors, but for others of us it's quite a frightening prospect.
Barcus Wroot: And so... to Moonrise Towers I go.
Karlach: Barcus has the right idea. We've got to get to Moonrise too - and soon.
Player: Do you know what the Ironhand Gnomes were doing down here?
Barcus Wroot: No.
Player: Do you know what Wulbren and the others were doing down here?
Barcus Wroot: No.
Player: Do you know what the Ironhand Gnomes were doing down here?
Barcus Wroot: No.
Player: Farewell, Barcus - I wish you luck with your search.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The party enters camp, and Wyll walks out of the shadows or otherwise appears in a surprising way. He holds his starting blade in his hand.
Karlach: The Blade of Frontiers. Thought I'd shaken you for good after the mind flayer ship. But you just can't get enough of me, can you.
Wyll: Karlach. The stink of Avernus.
Player: You two know each other, I see.
Karlach: Like a hammer knows an untouchable nail. Look, I'm not -
Narrator: *A great fire roars through you - the fire of the First Hell.*
Narrator: *You are the Blade of Frontiers, racing through the wastes of Avernus. Just ahead, a diabolical figure - red skin, single curled horn - blazes with flame, bloodied greataxe held high.*
Narrator: *He chases the fiend, ignited with rancour. She is an infernal wardevil, a threat to the living - evil incarnate.*
Wyll: Your ally's a fraud - a soldier in the archdevil Zariel's army. Either I cut her down, or she burns the Sword Coast to ash.
Karlach: I've tried to tell you - I'm not what you think I am. I'm - ngh!
Narrator: *Another vision. Karlach's blade raised, slicing through devils - Zariel's servants - as her eyes dart around, seeking escape.*
Narrator: *The man shudders with Karlach's desperation. She is a victim of the Blood War, not an agent of it.*
Wyll: By Balduran's helm, I - no. I will not be tricked!
Karlach: You saw the truth. I may be an effective soldier, but I never wanted to serve Zariel. Legged it away from her the first chance I got.
Wyll: And yet you served.
Player: Stand down. You saw what I saw - Karlach is not a danger.
Wyll: No. Devils can not be trusted!
Player: You saw Karlach's thoughts. She poses no threat to the Sword Coast.

Duke Ulder Ravengard: The Absolute's voice is gone, but I still hear its echoes - reflections of reflections.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: As you wish.
Player: Florrick is free. She's gathering allies as we speak.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Tremendous news. She proves as loyal to you as she is to me.

Wyll: Your ally's a fraud - a soldier in the archdevil Zariel's army. Either I cut her down, or she burns the Sword Coast to ash.
Karlach: I've tried to tell you - I'm not what you think I am. I'm - ngh!
Narrator: *Another vision. Karlach's blade raised, slicing through devils - Zariel's servants - as her eyes dart around, seeking escape.*
Narrator: *The man shudders with Karlach's desperation. She is a victim of the Blood War, not an agent of it.*

Player: Gods, you're stubborn. Karlach's not a devil, and you know it.

Zevlor: We were bound for Baldur's Gate, and it was too late to turn back. Elturel had no place for tieflings after the Descent.
Narrator: *You remember it. Elturel and all its citizens were dragged into Avernus - then back out again.*
Player: Let me guess: Your old neighbours called you 'devilkin' and acted like they never knew you.
Zevlor: How easily such a nasty word slips through the mouth of someone you thought you knew.
Zevlor: We thought we'd found sanctuary here, but the druids have determined to turn us out.
Zevlor: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
Player: This ritual - is there no way to convince the druids to stop it?
Zevlor: I've tried. Kagha - their new First Druid - won't even see me.
Zevlor: You, though... I know it's not your business, but she owes you for saving this place.
Zevlor: Perhaps you could persuade her. For more time to prepare, if nothing else.
Player: I'll see what I can do.
Player: I'll find her. And I'll speak to Kagha while I'm there.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The party approaches a mind flayer pod. Inside is the half-devil Mizora, Wyll's patron. She pushes her hands against the transparent cover and smiles. Next to the pod is a console with two buttons on it, the 'unleash' and 'annihilate' buttons on the console in the tutorial.
Mizora: By Graz'zt's cock, it's about time you came.
Player: Figures. All that talk about 'Zariel's asset', I should've known you were lying.
Mizora: Why, perish the thought. Every word was nothing less than true.
Mizora: Thought you'd have figured it out before now.
Mizora: Now enough sniffing around and get me out of this thing.
Narrator: *Your eyes turn to the control panel next to the pod. It has two devices marked with illithid symbols.*
Narrator: *The controls are open to your tadpole's command - to your authority.*
Player: Gather your strength and smash your foot through the pod.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: [reuse]  The player's fist slams against the pod and it cracks open.

Mizora steps out of the pod.

Mizora steps out of the pod.
Mizora: Good work. I'd give you a gold star, but I'm fresh out.

Karlach: Ngh...

NodeContext: A sound that could be mistaken for a fire building within her, or consuming her from within
Karlach: Well I'll be godsdamned - the Blade of Frontiers. Thought I'd shaken you for good. That'll teach me to underestimate you.
Lae'zel: Chk. This is Zariel's servant wreaking havoc on the Coast?
Karlach: Look - it's an honour to be chased by a famed hero. I'm no devil, though. Not by a long shot.
Wyll: You were engulfed in flames but a moment ago. Only a devil could have survived it.
Karlach: I can explain. But it's a whole situation.
Karlach: If you'd just hear me out -
Narrator: *The parasites connect you, a vision unfolds. Karlach's blade raised, slicing through devils - Zariel's servants - as her eyes dart around, seeking escape.*
Narrator: *Her rage and desperation seep into you. She is a victim of the Blood War, not an agent of it.*
Karlach: Fuck...
Wyll: I'll give you one chance to explain what I just saw.
Karlach: I never wanted to serve Zariel. I was enlisted in her army against my will. Forced to fight, and fight I did.
Karlach: When I saw an opportunity to get away, I took it. I'm finally home - or near it, anyway.
Wyll: No - I can't believe it. I've been sent to kill you. I can't let you go.
Karlach: Please. It's Wyll, right? We don't have to do this.
Shadowheart: Stand down, Wyll. She's fiery, but no devil.
Narrator: *If you believe her, killing her would be a crime. But break your pact, and the consequences will be unfathomable.*
Wyll: You don't know what this means. You don't know what you're asking me to do.
Karlach: I'm asking you to live, Wyll. I don't want to hurt you. And, to be frank, I'd rather not find out how the Blade got his name.
Wyll: It will mean my undoing, but... I believe you.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The present players are raised into the air and turned on their back in the style of a speak with dead. They hover above the ground.
Narrator: *The dragon's spirit floods your mind and memory in a great torrent of power. He is with you, he is within you, he is you.*
Narrator: *The next words that spill from your mouth are not yours, but the wyrm's.*
Ansur: I am Ansur, Heart of the Gate - butchered in flesh, risen in spirit.
Player: Bite back the words that aren't yours.
Narrator: *Ansur binds you despite your best efforts - yet thought flows effortlessly between you.*
Narrator: *The spirit pauses, and you feel the Astral Prism stir. Ansur senses the Emperor's presence within it.*
Ansur: Answer me, faessi: why have you come?
NodeContext: face-SEE (coward)
Player: I mean you no harm. Just let me go.
Narrator: *A deep sigh resonates within you. The torrent stills, only disturbed by the dragon's next words.*
Ansur: Vrak. My words aren't meant for you - they're meant for him.
NodeContext: vrahk. 'Child'. ux bah-hah-MYOO-tee 'Dragonborn'
[description] CinematicNodeContext: The space changes - a vision space. The Emperor appears in flesh. When the player speaks

JLatino: CUT ", we see Ansur's animated bones behind."

JLatino: CUT ", we see Ansur's animated bones behind."
Narrator: *The Emperor stirs in the Astral Prism, then in you - calm, curious, and detached.*
Ansur: Balduran.
Ansur: Your presence has stirred me, as it ever did. I am awakened.
GROUP_Emperors: Ansur. It's been too long.
Wyll: Balduran? No. I don't believe it.
Player: He called you Balduran?
GROUP_Emperors: A name I once answered to. A name I did not expect to hear again, least of all from the mouth of an old friend.
Ansur: Friend, yes - and more.
Ansur: Until you killed me.
Ansur: Have you come to dance on my bones, Balduran? Was slaying me not satisfaction enough?
GROUP_Emperors: Satisfaction? No. You left me no choice.
Ansur: You had every choice. You were becoming illithid. I offered you merciful death; you chose to fight.
Ansur: And now you bring your thrall before me. How far has the great Balduran fallen?
Player: A touching reunion. Now how about letting me go?
Narrator: *Stillness. Ansur's consciousness hovers just above yours, searching, seeing.*
GROUP_Emperors: Dear Ansur -
Ansur: Enough!
Ansur: I gave you everything, Balduran - and you repaid me in slaughter. It is time I return the favour.
Ansur: I am the Heart of the Gate. I am The One Who Roars.
Ansur: Let my bones rise and the storms gather. Witness, Balduran - the final tempest has come.
Ansur: This time, you will not escape it!

Narrator: *You are enveloped in myriad sensations, all at once. Flaming desire and icy despair; the strength of iron and the haze of thick swamp mist.*

Player: I'm not so sure about this, Mizora.

Player: Give in to the infernal sensations.

Mizora: Let me show you.
Player: Sigh and brace yourself.
Mizora: What's the matter. Don't you trust me?
Narrator: *An inferno engulfs you. Your lust blazes hot.*

Mizora: Where your rightful mistress shoulders the burdens of perpetual war.
Mizora: Reach out. Have a taste.
Player: Give it to me.
Narrator: *The flavour is exquisite as spiced wine, terrible as rotting offal. It does not quench your lust - it only stokes it.*

The player makes a fist, the flame extinguishes, but in doing so a new flood of sensation rushes into their core. Their back and neck arch slightly as they breath deep.
Mizora: Don't worry, pet. I won't leave 'til you're fully satisfied.
Mizora: Dis, the blackened elysium. Minauros, the rotting bog. The molten seas and soil of Phlegethos. Stygia, the frozen ocean.
Mizora: Choose a Hell. Have your fill.
Player: None of the above. This is horrific.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: [opening, face-to-face]

Wyll and Karlach stand facing one another, fists clenched.

Wyll and Karlach stand facing one another, fists clenched.
Karlach: Well I'll be godsdamned - the Blade of Frontiers. Thought I'd shaken you for good. That'll teach me to underestimate you.
Astarion: Oh marvellous, you've already met.
Karlach: If by 'met' you mean hoofing it through the Hells with this fucker on my tail.
Karlach: Look - it's an honour to be chased by a famed hero. I'm no devil, though. Not by a long shot.
Wyll: My sources say otherwise. Not a devil? Prove it.
Karlach: How should I do that exactly? Carve out my soul to serve with a nice side of turnips?
Karlach: If you'd just hear me out -
Narrator: *A great fire roars through you - the fire of the First Hell.*
Narrator: *Her rage and desperation seep into you. She is a victim of the Blood War, not an agent of it.*
Karlach: Fuck. I'll never get used to that.
Karlach: Look, whatever else it may be, the tadpole isn't a liar. I never wanted to serve Zariel, and I escaped the first chance I could. So stand down.
NodeContext: Ready for a fight if needed.
Gale: Easy, Wyll. She's no devil. There's no fight to be had here.
Shadowheart: Let's take things down a notch, shall we? She's no devil, Wyll. You'll have to look elsewhere to find fodder for your blade.
Wyll: You don't know what this means. You don't know what you're asking me to do.
Karlach: I'm asking you to live, Wyll. I don't want to hurt you. And, to be frank, I'd rather not find out how the Blade got his name.
Karlach: I swear to you, on all I am, I'm not what you think.
Narrator: *Two souls hang in the balance. Kill Karlach, fulfil your contract - and condemn a possible innocent to the Hells. Or spare her and face the repercussions with Mizora.*
Wyll: I'm sorry, Karlach. There's too much at stake.

Raphael: There. Middle-of-somewhere.
Karlach: I don't like this at all.
Player: Reach for your weapon.
Raphael: Tut tut. No need for that crude cutlery of yours. As you can see, I'm amply provisioned.
NodeContext: He gestures across the table: plenty of silverware present.
Raphael: This is the House of Hope. Where the tired come to rest, and the famished come to feed - lavishly.
Raphael: Go on. Partake. Enjoy your supper. After all...
Raphael: ...it might just be your last.
Player: I'm getting tired of your games.
Raphael: Fair enough.
Raphael: What's better than a devil you don't know?
Raphael: A devil you do.
Wyll: Hollering hells - you're a cambion.
Raphael: And so much more.
Raphael: Am I a friend? Potentially. An adversary? Conceivably. But a saviour? That's for certain.
Player: Why would you help me?
Raphael: Because my compassion is boundless. I stride among the needy, giving comfort where I can.
Raphael: And you're in dire need. One skull, two tenants, and no solution in sight.
Raphael: I could fix it all like that.
NodeContext: He snaps his fingers on the word 'that'. As he does so, the candle flames suddenly shine unnaturally bright, bathing the scene in a hellish red glow.
Player: You're mad if you think I'll make a deal with a devil.
